item.title: Judicial oversight of suspected violations of fundamental rights in the execution of Eulex Kosovo and the Advocate General's Ćapeta's Opinion in Joined Cases C-29/22 P and C-44/22 P.
item.description:
Antje Kunst* Photo credit: Sharon Hahn Darlin, via Wikimedia Commons In a recent legal opinion, Advocate General Ćapeta addressed the question of whether individuals can sue the European Union for damages related to alleged fundamental rights violations during an EU mission. The case involved KS and KD, whose family members disappeared and were killed in Kosovo in 1999. They allege that Eulex Kosovo, an EU mission tasked with investigating such crimes, failed to adequately investigate their cases...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/judicial-oversight-of-suspected-violations-of-fundamental-rights-in-the-execution-of-eulex-kosovo-and-the-advocate-general-s-apeta-s-opinion-in-joined-cases-c-29-22-p-and-c-44-22-p/

item.title: The CJEU's Ruling in Case C-632/20 P Spain v Commission (Kosovo) on Third Parties, Nations, and Other Entities
item.description:
Eva Kassoti, Senior Researcher, CLEER academic co-ordinator, T.M.C. Asser Institute. E-mail: E.Kassoti@asser.nl Photo credit: Aljabakphoto, via Wikimedia commons - Šar Mountains National Park in Dragaš, Kosovo On January 17th, 2023, the Court of Justice of the European Union (CJEU) issued its judgment in Case C-632/20 P, Spain v Commission (Kosovo), deciding that Kosovo can participate in the Body of European Regulators for Electronic Communications (BEREC). This decision, reached despite the EU’s non-recognition of Kosovo as a state, clarifies that “third country” status, as defined by the EU, can include territories not recognized as sovereign states and that these entities are eligible for participation in EU agencies...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-cjeu-s-ruling-in-case-c-632-20-p-spain-v-commission-kosovo-on-third-parties-nations-and-other-entities/
